question.text: Which of the following statements is correct about cockroach?

options.text: In females, the 6<sup>th</sup> sternum is boat-shaped and together with the 7<sup>th</sup> and 8<sup>th</sup> sterna form a brood or genital pouch
In males, the genital pouch is bounded dorsally by 9<sup>th</sup> and 10<sup>th</sup> sterna and ventrally by the 9<sup>th</sup> tergum
Females bear a pair of short, threadlike anal styles which are absent in males
The 10<sup>th</sup> segment has a pair of filamentous structures called anal cerci

solution.text: In cockroach, both males and females have 10 abdominal segments. In females, the genital pouch is made up of 7<sup>th</sup>, 8<sup>th</sup> and 9<sup>th</sup> abdominal sterna. Out of this, 7<sup>th</sup> sternum is boat-shaped. In male cockroaches, the genital pouch is bound by the 9<sup>th</sup> abdominal sternum on the ventral side and 9<sup>th</sup> and 10<sup>th</sup> terga on the dorsal side. Anal styles are a pair of short structures found only in males. They are absent in females. Anal cerci are a pair of filamentous structures found in the 10<sup>th</sup> abdominal segment of both males and females.
